loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread.

loans.name: Gorretti

texts.en:
Gorretti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with six children, four of whom attend school. She is also looking after her siblings as well. She stays in her house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees.

She has been selling beans, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava and yams in the market at retail for ten years, working six days a week. She also has rental houses as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to be able to purchase more yams, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes for sale. 

Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to grow her business and be able to collect the food herself from the villages, thus yielding higher profits. She joined MCDT because of its interest in serving the poor.

loans.use: To buy more yams, sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in seaweed farming, together with her husband, for more than ten years now.

Evangeline needs a loan for the expansion of her business. With a loan, she will be able to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming.

In the future, Evangeline dreams of improving their business and continuing to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, rope and sticks for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child who is not attending school. She also looks after her parents.

She has been operating a retail shop selling basic commodities for ten years, working seven days a week, except when she is sick. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more flour, cooking oil, thread, needles, sugar, rice, and stationery to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to own a big stationery shop together with other necessary retail services. She joined MCDT because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She stays in a rented house with her husband; it has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, transport, electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy more flour, cooking oil, thread, needles, sugar, rice, and stationery to sell.

loans.name: Senor De Mayo-31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SENOR DE MAYO-31 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Susy tiene 40 años, casada  tiene tres hijos de las edades de 1, 5 y 8 años, dos ellos en edad escolar,   La Sra. Susy  se dedica al servicio de gastronomía, ella elabora comida especial para distintos acontecimientos sociales, ya sea matrimonios, bautizos, etc.   este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Susy va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de utensilios para la elaboración de su comida, ya que estas fechas tiene mucha demanda por la gran cantidad de matrimonios, promociones y bautizos que se llevan a cabo    su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Susy va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Susy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The entrepreneurship bank, Señor de Mayo-31, is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. The president of this bank is Susy, who is 40 years old, married, and has three children ages 1, 5, and 8. Two of her children are now in school. Susy makes a living from her cooking business. She cooks for special occasions such as weddings, baptisms, etc. 

This is Susy's second loan from this lending institution. She will use it to buy a variety of kitchen utensils to help her cook during the busy season, full of weddings, promotions, and baptisms coming up. She is requesting this loan in order to continue to improve her business and keep it well-stocked. This will help her increase her profits.

Susy is a very hardworking woman. She is happy that she and the other group members have been offered this opportunity, since most of them are the only source of income to help their families get ahead.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for her catering business.

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI”  iniciará el decimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tucumanas, venta de camas, pastelería, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de golosinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Cecilia es parte integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de pastelería, que aprendió en su colegio que le enseñaron oficios técnicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina y leche) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “RUBI” community association is in its sixteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani center.  The group is made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Maria serves as the president.  The businesses that the other members have a number of small businesses including: tucumana sales, bed sales, cake sales, food sales, sweater knitting, neighborhood store, and snack sales. 
  

The money from this loan will benefit their small businesses and Cecilia, a member of the group who is her third cycle with Pro Mujer, joined on the invitation of a friend who is also a member.  She has two pastry businesses.  She learned this at a trade school.


She will use the money from this loan to buy flour and milk from distributors in El Alto.  She will later make and sell her products out of her home.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to help support her household.  She is married and has three children.
 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training in health and credit and being with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy flour and milk.

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
La Sra. MAría del Rosario, es socia del grupo de nombre San Martin de Porres, el cual ha sido formado recientemente, entre compañeras de trabajo de la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catalogo y han  incluido a unos vecinos de la zona en la que viven.
La Sra. María del Rosario se dedica desde hace unos años a la venta de productos de belleza, maquillajes, perfumes y joyería, trabajo que realiza por medio de catálogos y acomodando su tiempo libre ya que la facilidad de este negocio es que no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo por lo que ella puede disponer de su tiempo y asi poder dedicarse a sus hijos y no descuida su casa.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de maquillajes y joyería que en éste tiempo por la campaña navideña está a precios de oferta.
texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is a member of the group called San Martin de Porres, which was formed recently by a groups of co-workers who sell beauty products via catalog.  They have included some neighbors from the zone where they live.


Maria del Rosario has been selling beauty products for a few years.  She sells makeup, perfumes, and jewelry and works from catalogs.  She doesn’t have a set schedule and this allows her to adjust her spare time so that she can care for her children and home.


She will use the money from this loan to invest in makeup and jewelry that is available at special prices during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lesly Robles

texts.es:
La señora Lesly  Rubenia de 54  años de edad es madre soltera, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 12  años al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado,  radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de honduras, su venta la realiza  con las personas que ha diario le visitan en su negocio y amigos que llegan a visitarle.
Doña Lesly está solicitando el préstamo para compra de blusas, sandalias y pantalones, camisas, faldas, calzonetas, tenis y zapatos, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea surtir su negocio y prepararse con mercadería para esta navidad, y con las ganancias desea mejorar su casa y también cubrir sus necesidades de salud.
Doña Lesly su sueño es comprarse un carro.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Lesly Rubenia is 54 years old and a single mother, although her children are no longer dependent on her for support.  She has been selling shoes and clothing for 12 years and lives in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She sells to friends and other people who visit her business daily.


Lesly is asking for a loan in order to buy blouses, sandals, pants, shirts, skirts, undergarments, sneakers, and shoes.  She wants to use this loan to stock her business and prepare it with Christmas merchandise.  She also wants to use the profits to make improvements to her home and cover her health expenses.


She would like to buy herself a car.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Nelly Sohamy

texts.es:
La  Joven Nelly de 21 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa de un familiar, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva, en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y por sus buenos precios, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Nelly está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa nueva como ser: blusas, faldas, ropa de niño, pantalones, calzonetas, vestidos, suéteres, calcetines y sandalias. Con el apoyo del préstamo ella va invertir más en su negocio y desea obtener buenas ganancias,  que las utilizara  para seguir invirtiéndolo en su negocio y de esa manera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.
Nelly su sueño es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Nelly, a 21-year-old young woman, lives with her husband in the house of a relative.  She has no dependent children.  She has made a living for two years in the business selling clothing in the neighborhoods and developments of San Lorenzo.  Her customers prefer her for her good treatment and good prices.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Nelly's requesting the loan to buy new clothing: blouses, skirts, children's clothing, pants, underpants, dresses, sweaters, socks, and sandals.  With the support of the loan she'll invest more in her business.  She wants to get good profits, which she'll use to continue investing in her business so she can improve her quality of life somewhat.

Nelly's dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, children's clothing, pants, underpants, dresses, sweaters, socks, and sandals

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is engaged in a fishing business since her husband is a fisherman. Evangeline is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve their business and save money for schooling of their son.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks and buckets

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is with six children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members. She stays in a rented house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

Rose has been involved in selling cooked food, door-to-door, retail for three years, working six days a week. She does not have any other additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more yams, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and cassava for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to own a restaurant so that she stops moving from place to place selling food. She joined MCDT because of the low interest charge on loans.

loans.use: To buy more yams, beef, rice, Irish potatoes and cassava for sale

loans.name: Espie

texts.en:
Espie is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. Her husband works as a fisherman. Espie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Espie hopes of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Gentiana

texts.en:
Gentiana is a 32-year-old, married mother of two school-aged children, eleven and eight, who lives in the northern region of Albania. She is requesting a loan from VisionFund Albania for the first time. Gentiana wants to repair a damaged stable for her animals and the amount she’s requesting from Kiva lenders is approximately 460 USD. 

She has been operating a livestock business for about ten years now, and has been able to see progress in this activity. “The profit hasn’t been that bad either; I have worked hard, and I do not want to bypass on this fact. My husband has been helping out as well by taking the milk to residents of a main city close to our location to sell,” Gentiana said.

loans.use: To repair a damaged stable

loans.name: Sandra Jaqueline

texts.es:
La señora Sandra de 34 años de edad, vive con  su esposo, tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja y la apoya en todo, vive en casa de un hermano, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de ropa usada, su negocio lo tiene en su casa y también realiza ventas ambulantes tres veces por semana, sus clientes le prefieren por su amabilidad y buen trato y por la variedad de ropa buena que ella vende.
Doña  Sandra es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Sandra necesita el préstamo para comprar faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos, calzonetas y suéteres, en  fardos de ropa usada clasificada, ya que se acerca la época de navidad donde se vende bastante este tipo de ropa.
Doña Sandra con el apoyo del préstamo surtirá su negocio y tendrá mejores ganancias que ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Doña Sandra su sueño es tener su casa propia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra, 34, lives together with her husband and has two children that depend on her. Her husband works and supports her in everything. She lives in her brother’s house.

For three years, Sandra has been selling used clothes at home, but she also sells in the streets three times a week. Her customers prefer her because of her kindness, good service, and because of the assortment and good quality she offers. Mrs. Sandra is an enterprising woman and has a strong will to get ahead in life. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, Southern Honduras.

Mrs. Sandra needs the loan to buy skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts and sweaters in bundles of classified used clothes. Now that the Christmas season is coming, these types of clothes are highly demanded.

With the help of the loan, she will stock her business up and will receive better profits, which will help her to improve her and her family’s quality of life. Sandra’s dream is to have her own house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November 2012.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, shorts and sweaters for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 35-year-old married woman and has been engaged in the rice farming business for several years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm lot.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Erlinda hopes of improving their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie earns a living through her 'sari-sari' or variety store business. She has been in this business for more than five years now. She sells various goods to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol.

Elvie is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, rice, chips and snack foods, sodas and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store.

In the future, Elvie aims to expand her business. In addition, she wants to save money so that she can continue supporting her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, noodles, rice, chips and snack foods, sodas and toiletries

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is a fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. Levi is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With this, he will be able to enhance his daily catch thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market.

Levi has hopes of expanding his business in the future so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El señor Máximo de 38 años de edad, vive con  su esposa, tiene 03 hijos  que dependen de el, vive en casa de su suegra, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de pan en su motocicleta, el visita las pulperías y demás negocios para ofrecer sus productos, su venta es de lunes a domingo.
Don Máximo es un hombre trabajador, el se levanta muy temprano todo los días,trabajar como panadero y luego por la jornada de la tarde trabaja en su propio negocio, este hombre es un ejemplo de perseverancia y trabajo es digno de admiración.
Don Maximo necesita el préstamo para aperturar un nuevo negocio de tajadas de plátano verde, con el apoyo del préstamo él desea comprar manteca, plátano verde, sal y leña que necesita para elaborar las tajadas de plátano en su casa ya que quiere involucrar a su familia en esta actividad, esta muy contento de trabajar con Prisma.
Don Maximo su sueño es tener su propia casa y su nuevo negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
38-year-old Maximo lives with his wife, has three children who depend on him, and lives his mother-in-law's house. For five years he has made a living selling bread on his motorcycle. He visits local stores and businesses to offer his goods. He sells from Monday to Sunday. 

Maximo is a hardworking man and gets up very early every day, working as a break salesman and later as a day worker in the afternoon in his own business. He is an example of perseverance and work, and is admired by others.

Maximo needs this loan to open a new business selling slices of plantain in his house, since he already has family involved in this business. He is very happy to work with Prisma. 

Maximo's dream is to have his own house and a new business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase butter, green bananas, salt and firewood for his business

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Reina de 45 años de edad, vive con  su esposo,  tiene 03 hijos  que dependen de ella, su esposo trabaja y la apoya en todo, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 13  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería y ropa usada, su negocio lo tiene en su casa y ahí llegan sus clientes y amigos que le llegan a comprar sus productos.
Doña Reina necesita el préstamo para comprar faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas y blusas de ropa usada clasificada, ya que se acerca la época navideña donde se vende bastante este tipo de ropa.
Doña Reina con el apoyo del préstamo surtirá su negocio y espera obtener ganancias que ayuden a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Reina su sueño es que su familia este bien y muy unida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Señora Reina is 45 years old, lives with her husband, and has three children who depend on her.  Her husband works and she supports him in everything.  She has her own house, and for 13 years she has made a living through the business of selling groceries and used clothing.  She has her business in her home, where her customers and friends come to buy her products.

Doña Reina needs the loan in order to buy secondhand clothing like skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, and blouses because it is nearing the Christmas season when this type of clothing sells well.

With the help of the loan, Doña Reina will stock up her store and she hopes to get earnings that help to improve her quality of life and the life of her family a little bit.  Doña Reina's dream is for her family to be well and very close-knit.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November  2012

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a 39-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has been running a 'sari-sari' or variety store business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Lenita works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips, soda, beverages, and toiletries. This loan will definitely help her in expanding her business and earnings.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, chips, sodas, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family. She has been selling raw food like green bananas, Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes, and cassava in the market at retail for twenty-three years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 400,000 from MCDT- SACCO to be able to buy more green bananas, cassava, and Irish potatoes for sale. Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business. She joined MCDT because she had little capital to support the business. She stays in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more green bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She owns a motorcycle transport business. Her husband uses it to deliver products like dry goods and bread to neighboring stores in their place. They are also engaged in a rice farming business.

Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motorcycle and fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their earnings.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motorcycle and fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, all of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional member of the family.

She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for eight years, working six days a week. She does not have any additional income.

Nulu has requested a loan of UShs 900,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to buy a vehicle and stop hiring one for transportation and also to educate her children up to university. She joined MCDT because services are taken to clients` localities. She stays in a rented house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

She has been selling vegetables like onions, tomatoes, garlic, cabbages, and eggplants, and also oatmeal in the market at retail for the last ten years, working six days a week. She also sells second-hand clothes as another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 1,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy cabbages, onions, eggplants, lettuce, garlic, oatmeal and tomatoes. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to get her own land and grow the vegetables herself. She joined MCDT because the loan interest is relatively low. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages, eggplants, tomatoes, garlic, onions, lettuce, and oatmeal

loans.name: Hanifah

texts.en:
Hanifah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, four of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family member.

She has been selling spare parts for motorcycles in a shop at retail for the last four years, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more shock absorbers, lights, batteries, and spikes for sale. Her challenges include transportation and thieves. Her dream is to have a repair workshop and also to own a fully stocked spare parts shop. She joined MCDT because it was relatively easy to join with low loan interest. She lives in her husband`s house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more shock absorbers, lights, batteries, and spikes for sale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with six children, all of whom currently attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after any other family members. For the past 20 years, Mariam has been selling second-hand clothing in the market. She works six days a week and her business is her only source of income. Mariam's business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of used clothes. She lives in her husband's house and has access to both electricity and running water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees. Mariam joined MCDT because the interest rate is relatively low.

Mariam is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy bales of used clothes such as skirts, blouses, and dresses to sell. Her dream is to own a big shop and also to become an importer of used clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing such as skirts, blouses, and dresses to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after any other family members. For the past seven years, Ruth has been selling second-hand skirts in the market. She works seven days a week and also manages rental houses as another source of income. Ruth's business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She lives with her husband and her family has access to both electricity and running water. Ruth's major monthly expenses are school fees. She joined MCDT because their interest rates are relatively low.

Ruth is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes such as skirts, dresses, and blouses to sell. Her dream is to have a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and also looks after her sisters. For the past three months, Rehema has been in the second-hand clothing business. She works six days a week and also is a nurse to earn another source of income. Rehema's business challenges include seasonality. She lives with her husband, and her family has access to electricity but not running water. Rehema's major monthly expenses include school fees.

Rehema is requesting a 1,000,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes such as skirts, blouses, and dresses to sell. Her dream is to build her business into a well-stocked boutique.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Erina

texts.en:
Erina is single with four children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and is not looking after any other family members. For the past eight years, Erina has been operating a restaurant. She works seven days a week and her business is her only source of income. Erina's business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She rents a house without electricity or running water and her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. Erina joined MCDT because of low interest rates

Erina is requesting a 900,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy rice, beans, ground nuts, cow peas, beef, green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, chicken, cooking oil, and charcoal. Her dream is to own a big hotel.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, ground nuts, cow peas, beef, green bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, chicken, cooking oil, and charcoal

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen de 60 años de edad es casada, no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de lácteos y  ropa nueva, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, tiene una casa propia.
Doña Carmen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de faldas, pantalones, vestidos, camisas, blusas, suéteres y calcetines, desea invertir un poco en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias por que en esta época se vende bastante la ropa. 
Doña Carmen con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que sus ingresos mejoren, y su deseo es que en un futuro su negocio sea más grande, para tener mejores utilidades y así mejorar su casa. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is 60 years old and married. All of her children are independent. She has had a business selling dairy goods and new clothing for six years. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She sells her wares as a street vendor in the neighborhoods and suburbs. She owns her home. 

Doña Carmen is requesting a loan to purchase skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, sweaters and socks. She wants to invest a little in her business so that she can earn more income because clothing sells well during this season. She hopes her business expands in the future so that she will have more profits and be able to make improvements on her home.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  November, 2012.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, pants, dresses, shirts, blouses, sweaters and socks for her business.

loans.name: Triunfadoras De 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRIUNFADORAS 25 DE JULIO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de frituras,  tejido de mantas, macramé, carpintería, venta de herramientas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Julia es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de costura, porque aprendió esta habilidad de un trabajo anterior que realizaba en Argentina y al volver a Bolivia emprendió su propia microempresa.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “TRIUNFADORAS 25 DE JULIO” community association will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collapani center.  It’s made up of eight members and directed by a board of directors where Julia serves as the president.  The members have various types of businesses such as: fried foods, wall hanging knitting, macramé, carpentry, and sale of tools.


This loan will benefit the small businesses and this is Julia’s first time with Pro Mujer, having joined upon a friend’s invitation who is also a member.  She has two sewing businesses and learned this in her previous job in Argentina.  She started her small business when she returned to Bolivia.



She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric from distributers in El Alto.  She will then make and sell items from her point of sale.  This type of work allows her to help support her household.  She’s married and has two children.



When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Matilde Apolonio

texts.es:
Matilde, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a la ganadería tiene 12 animales entre ellos vacas y terneros, este negocio es de familia, las ventajas es que tiene el terreno para potrero en lugares húmedos que siempre están verdes para el pasto que le sirve de alimento al ganado.

Se solicita un préstamo para la compra de dos vacas, esto le ayudará a incrementar el número en sus terrenos y el futuro tener una posible ganancia.

Su objetivo con el préstamo es crecer en la ganadería ya que esto le permitirá obtener mayor lucro para poder solventar algunas necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Matilde is 49 years old and lives with his wife and four children.  He raises livestock and has 12 animals, such as cows and steers.  This is a family business and he has his own land with plenty of green pastures for his livestock.  He is asking for a loan in order to buy two cows that will increase his livestock.  In the future this will increase his income.  His goal is to grow his business and profits to provide some of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda, and does not look after any additional family members. For the past ten years, Oliver has sold charcoal from home. She works seven days a week and also manages rental houses as another source of income. Oliver's challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her family has access to both electricity and running water and her major monthly expenses include school fees. Oliver joined MCDT because the staff members are friendly and it is cheap to become a member.

Oliver is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from MCDT- SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her dream is to expand her business to earn profits to build more rental houses and to buy a delivery van to improve transportation.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yesmin

texts.es:
La señora Yesmin de 31  años de edad es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, y tortillas con quesillo, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo.
Doña Yesmin está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como carnes, tomates, tortillas, quesillo, repollo, papas y condimentos ya que desea  invertir un poco en su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias ya que en esta época se vende bastante. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar un poco su situacion economica y la de su familia, y su deseo es hacer más grande  su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Yesmin, 31 years old, is a single mother with three children who are dependent on her. She owns her own home. She has been selling snacks such as tacos, enchiladas and tortillas with cheese for three years. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She is a street vendor in the neighborhoods and suburbs of San Lorenzo.

Doña Yesmin is requesting a loan to buy basic ingredients such as meat, tomatoes, tortillas, cheese, cabbage, potatoes and condiments. She wants to invest a little in her business so she can earn more income because snacks are selling well during this season. With help from this loan she hopes to improve her financial situation a little and that of her family. She would also like to expand her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November,l 2012.

loans.use: to purchase meat, tomatoes, tortillas, cheese, cabbage, potatoes and condiments for her business..

loans.name: Arco Iris Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento ARCO IRIS II está  compuesto por nueve integrantes todas mujeres, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Elena tiene 53 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 17  y 19 años, los dos se encuentran estudiando en la universidad,   La Sra. Elena   se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Elena  va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Elena va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Elena es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Arco Iris II Communal Bank is made up of nine members, all women.  Elena, 53, is the president of the bank.  She has two children, ages 17 and 19, who are university students.

Elena makes a living selling staples such as groceries, sweets, soda, and a variety of items in her neighborhood store.  This loan is her second sequence with the institution.

Elena's going to use the loan to buy groceries to stock her business: rice, pasta, flour, and sugar wholesale.  This way she'll have a variety of products for her customers.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving in her business.  Elena's going to use the profits to continue buying products and improving her income.  Her desire for the business is to have a store and give her customers better service.

Elena's a very hardworking person.  She's happy about this opportunity and about her colleagues in the group because in many cases they're people who get their families ahead by themselves.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries

loans.name: Sewenkani-25 Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario SEWENKANI-25  está  compuesto por dos integrantes una  mujer y un varón,   La  coordinadora del  grupo  es la Sr.  Jose tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos que son dos varones de 10 y 12 años, el Sr.  Jose se dedica a la confección y costura de prendas de vestir el vive en la zona Sewenkani, este préstamo es el segundo que ha tomado con la institución y el Sr. Jose  va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de tela, hilo y otros para su negocio y la señora julia se dedica a preparación de dulces de maní confitado,  invertirá en la compra de maní por quintales para la elaboración para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo que no les permite crecer en su negocio y esto es un reto  en su negocio ya  que los clientes son pequeños productores, por lo que su capital es pequeño,  ellos quieren desarrollar más aun sus empresas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material e insumos para su negocio que crezcan y así poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sewenkani-25 Solidarity Group is made up of two members, a man and a woman.

José is the coordinator of the group.  He's 34 years old and has two sons, ages 10 and 12.  José makes a living making and sewing garments.  He lives in the Sewenkani area.  This is José's second loan with the institution and he's going to use it to buy fabric, thread, and other things for his business.

Julia makes a living selling candied peanut sweets.  She'll invest in buying peanuts by the quintal to make the sweets.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of cash, which doesn't let her grow in her business.  This is a challenge because the customers are small producers and she has little capital.

They want to grow more in their businesses, and they're going to use the profits to continue buying material and supplies so the businesses grow and they can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур живет в городе Истаравшан. Ему 24 года. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. Баходур занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. В его деятельности ему помогает жена. Он хочет взять кредит для покупки крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 24 years old and married with one child. Bahodur raises cattle for a living. His wife helps him in his work. He wishes to take out a loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Cristino Rubio

texts.es:
Cristino, es una persona Trabajadora y honrada, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 21 años de edad quien le ayuda en las labores de la casa, su ocupación y la crianza de ganado y la siembra de granos basicos, realiza estas actividades desde hace 35 años en la siembra de maíz, frijol y caña de azúcar y crianza de ganado, lo aprendió a sus padres y una de sus ventajas es que posee el terreno propio con pasto para poder mantenerlos.

Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en el pago de mano de obra para la limpieza de dos manzanas de caña de azúcar y prepararla para la molienda, de este proceso obtiene  los reciduos de la caña que le sirven para alimento del ganado, este crédito  ayudará a realizar esta actividad de la cual el producto final es dulce de laja como normalmente se le llama en esta zona, éste lo comercializa, con la molienda obtiene los dos beneficios que es la venta de dulce y también los recibos para alimentar el ganado.

El sueño es seguir trabajando por tener más ganancias y así poder ayudar a su hijo y a toda su familia, crear un negocio rentable que le permite generar un mejor ingreso económico para cuando ya no pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Cristino is a hardworking and honest person.  He lives with his wife and 21 year old son who both help him around the house.  He raises livestock and basic grains such as corn, beans, sugar cane and has been doing so for 35 years.  He learned all of this from his parents and he has the advantage of owning his own land.

He is asking for a loan to pay for labor to clear his sugar cane fields and prepare the cane for processing.  He uses the sugar cane residuals to feel his livestock.  This loan will help him do these things and produce “laja” candy, as it is known in this zone.  He gets a double benefit from his processor, sugar and feed.

His dream is to continue working to have more income and be able to help his son and all his family create a profitable business that will allow him to save for his retirement.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Perlas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas, tejido de camas y mantas, bordado de ropa, venta de celulares, trabajo de cerámica nacimiento, macramé, bordado de ropa de moreno, venta de fruta, producción de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Olga es parte integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una familiar que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de tejido de macramé, aprendiendo esta habilidad de su madre, ya que ella trabajaba hace años en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y la atención al cliente.
texts.en:
The “PERLAS BLANCAS” community association is beginning its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani center.  The group is made up of eleven members and directed by a board of directors, where Olga serves as president.  The members have various types of small businesses, including: sweater knitting, bedspreads and wall hangings, embroidering clothing, cell phone sales, ceramic work, macramé, fruit sales, and skirt making.


This loan will benefit the small businesses.  Olga, who is beginning her third year with Pro Mujer, and having joined upon invitation from another member, has two macramé businesses.  She learned this art from her mother who worked in this business for years.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric from distributers in El Alto.  She will then make and sell items from her point of sale.  In this way she can generate income with which to support her household.  She lives with her common law husband and has two children.


When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health and credit training and customer service.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Pozo De Jacob Group

texts.es:
La señora Olga  de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo, tiene 03 hijos  que depende de ella, vive en su casa que esta ubicada en la ciudad de San en la parte sur de Honduras, se dedica a la actividad de venta de zapatos,  desde hace 13  años,  sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad donde ella vive.
Doña Olga es una mujer trabajadora con mucha ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, también se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, es la líder del grupo solidario Pozo de Jacob, sus compañeras la eligieron por su entusiasmo y por el apoyo de ella brindado al grupo.
Doña Olga está solicitando el préstamo para compra de zapatos, tenis y sandalias de hombre, tiene varios pedidos de zapatos para esta temporada navideña, con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar  un poco su condición de vida y la de su familia y su sueño es que su negocio en un futuro sea más grande.
Doña Hilda  se dedica a la venta de ropa y granos básicos.
Doña Ciriaca se dedica a la venta de lácteos, este grupo es muy unido y su deseo es seguir trabajando con Prisma. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Olga is 30 years old, lives with her husband, and has three children who depend on her for support.  Her house is located in San, in southern Honduras.  She sells shoes and has been doing so for 13 years.  Her customers are friends and neighbors from her neighborhood.

Olga is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead with her family.  She also sells undergarments and is the leader of the Pozo de Jacob group.  Her fellow members elected her because of the support she has given to the group. 

Olga is asking for this loan to buy men’s shoes, sneakers, and sandals.  She has various requests for seasonal Christmas shoes and this loan will help her improve her living conditions and that of her family.  Her dream is to have a better future.

Hilda sells clothing and basic grains.

Ciriaca sells milk products.

This group is very united and wishes to continue working with Prisma.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Lidia Lissette

texts.es:
Lidia, se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera de una niña de cinco años y actualmente está embarazada, vive en una misma casa con su madre, el negocio de ella lo administra desde hace tres años, está instalado en su casa de habitación y atiende de lunes a sábado, su madre le ayuda en la preparación de los alimentos.

Actualmente Lidia solicita un préstamo para comprarse carne, aceite, arroz, frijoles, condimentos, y otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende en su vivienda, esta compra ayudará a tener lo necesario y poder aumentar la producción.

Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia sells food.  She’s 22 years old, pregnant, and the single mother of a five year old girl.  She lives with her mother and has been managing her business for the past three years.  It’s located in her home and she works Monday through Saturday.  Her mother helps her prepare the food.

Lidia is asking for a loan to buy meet, cooking oil, beans, condiments, and other things she needs to prepare the food she sells.  This will help her have what she needs to increase production on hand.

Her goal is to strengthen her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, es carpintero, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, todos trabajan en la familia, él aprendió esta actividad con unos amigos que tienen carpinterías, luego logró colocar su propio negocio y no tiene un horario establecido para atender la exigencia de los clientes.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para poderlo invertir en madera para fabricar muebles, por ejemplo madera de cedro, aceituno, pino, y otras que existen, este crédito será una ayuda que le permitirá crecer y tener la materia prima para trabajar.

Su aspiración en el negocio es tenerlo fortalecido a través de los préstamos ya que eso le permitirá aumentar sus ventas con la producción de muebles.
texts.en:
Juan is a carpenter and lives with his family; his wife and two children.  Everybody works.  He learned his trade from some friends who are also carpenters.  He was later able to set up his own business and doesn’t have a regular schedule so that he can serve his customers whenever they need him.

He is asking for this loan so that he can buy lumber, such as cedar, olive, pine, and other types to make furniture.  This loan will allow him to grow his business and have raw materials on hand.

His goal is to have a strong business with the help of loans that will allow him to increase sales and production.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos. Este es el nuevo grupo “Los Amigos Empresarios” conformado por 06 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad. Siendo una de las socias Marianela. Ella tiene 55 años casada con 02 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. Hace más de 01 años que Marianela se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como hamburguesa, pollo broster y caldo de gallina. Este negocio surgió con la idea de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, es por ello que tuvo que trabajar mucho.  Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos como pollo, hamburguesas, papas y aceite para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es de poner otro puesto de  venta de comida rápida en un lugar céntrico. El nuevo grupo  “Los Amigos Empresarios” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Marianela es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color anaranjado.
texts.en:
Pleasant Greetings.  This is a new group called, “Los Amigos Empresarios” and is made up of six enthusiastic members who began working with the Prosperidad Program.  Marianela, one of the members, is 55 years old, married, and has two children; one of them still depends on her for support.  She has been selling fast food, such as hamburgers, broasted chicken, and chicken soup, for more than a year.  She started this business because she wanted to improve her quality of life, so she has to work a lot.

She used the money from her most recent loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, hamburger meat, potatoes, and cooking oil for her business.  Her greatest desire is to set up a fast food stall in a central location.  The new group, “Los Amigos Empresarios,” is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Marianela is the first one on the left of the photograph, wearing an orange polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Simeon

texts.es:
José, vive solo, está soltero, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y presta servicios con molinos de nixtamal, este negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, lo tiene instalado en su propia casa, no tiene un horario establecido y cuenta con experiencia hecha en estas ventas.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para poderse comprar granos básicos para surtir el negocio por ejemplo maíz, frijol, arroz, café, que son algunos necesarios para poder vender, el crédito será una fortaleza que le permitirá abastecer el negocio y tenerlo surtido para los clientes.

Su aspiración es progresar, el negocio surtiendolo de buena mercadería a aumentar el número de clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Jose lives alone.  He’s single, sells basic grains and also provides grinding services with a mill.  He started this business on his own and has it set up in his home.  He doesn’t have a regular schedule and has lots of experience.


He is asking for this loan in order to buy basic grains, such as corn, beans, rice, and coffee to stock his business.  This loan will help strengthen his business and will allow him to have a well-stocked business for his customers


His aspirations are to make progress, have a well-stocked business, increase his number of customers, and meet his own needs.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Cristabel

texts.es:
Cristabel, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque considera necesario invertir en productos de belleza y la elaboración de piñatas, comprandose lociones, cremas, maquillaje, papel, cartón, pega y todo lo necesario para poder realizar su negocio.

Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo que se le financió ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios utilizandolos en el cuidado de sus hijos, también considera que está creciendo en el negocio a través del préstamo kiva sus condiciones están progresando.
texts.en:
Cristabel is asking for a new loan so that she can invest in beauty products and piñata making supplies, such as lotions, creams, makeup, paper, cardboard, glue and everything she needs for her business.

She says that this loan helps her obtain the income she needs to care for her children.  She also believes that her business is growing and getting better because of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy inventory and supplies.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El  Señor Javier tiene 47 años de edad, vive con su  Mamá, y 02 hijos en su casa de habitación en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 20  años a la venta de  refrescos, arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, carme, pollo, embutidos, pastas, salsas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan y otras personas de comunidades vecinas.
Don Javier está solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de carne, huevos, refrescos, mantaca, frijoles, salsa, leche, queso, jabón, embutidos, azúcar, arroz, agua, etc.con el préstamo espera obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan salir adelante con su familia.
Don Javier su sueño es terminar de arreglar su casa de habitación. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 201
texts.en:
Javier is 47 years old and lives with his mother and two children in his home, located in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  He has been selling soft drinks, rice, beans, lard, eggs, meat, chicken, sausages, pasta, and sauces.  His business is in his home and his customers are his friends, neighbors, and people from nearby neighborhoods who visit him daily. 

Javier is asking for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras to buy meat, egg, soft drinks, lard, beans, sauces, milk, cheese, ham, sausages, sugar, rice, water, etc.  This loan will help provide him obtain good earnings that will allow him to move his family ahead.

Javier’s dream is to finish fixing up his house.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
El señor  Juan de 32 años de edad, vive con  su esposa,  tiene 02 hijos  que dependen de él,  su esposa le ayuda a cuidar sus hijos, no tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la actividad de reparación de carros en su taller mecánico.
Don Juan  es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia, necesita el préstamo para comprar alicates, tenazas, cinceles, destornilladores, limas y llaves  herramientas que necesita para su taller de mecánica, y además necesita comprar los anillos de su taxi que lo tiene malo, es por tal razón que solicita los 5,000.00 lempiras, con el apoyo del préstamo desea realizar sus proyecto y mejorar su un poco su condición económica y la de su familia.
Don Juan su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children who depend on him for support.  His wife helps him care for the children.  They don’t have a home of their own.  He has been repairing cars in his shop for the past ten years.

Juan is a hardworking man, dedicated to his family and needs this loan to buy pliers, cutters, chisels, screwdrivers, files and wrenches that he needs for his shop.  He also needs to buy piston rings for his taxi, which is in need of repair.  He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Lempiras so that he can complete his plans and improve his family’s financial situation a bit.

Juan would like to have a home of his own.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Pioneras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PIONERAS – 26 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete  mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del  banco es La Sra. Ruth tiene 43 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 12, 18  años,  ella se dedica a la venta de papelería, material de escritorio,  libros etc. Ella vende variedad de productos según a la temporada, tiene ubicado su bazar librería en la zona de la Tejada, ella vive en casa familiar, ella solicita el crédito para proveerse de mercadería con la compra de material escolar para su librería – bazar ya que le va muy bien ya que por la ubicación del negocio tiene una buena venta y es una persona que cumple con sus pagos, es responsable y trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The PIONERAS – 26 entrepreneur bank is made up of eight members; seven ladies and one gentleman.  Ruth is the president.  She is 43 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 18.  She sells paper goods, school supplies, books, etc.  She sells a variety of products depending on the season.  Her shop is located in the Tejada zone and she lives in a home of her own.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her shop.  Things are going well for her because of the location of her business and because she is very responsible about her payments.  She is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une dame âgée de 46 ans et mère d'un enfant de 19 ans qui va à l'école. elle a en plus de son enfant une autre personne à sa charge. comme activité elle dispose d'un stand sur lequel elle vend de la nourriture depuis 02 ans dans un quartier de la ville. elle voudrait avec ce crédit effectuer des travaux de réaménagement dans le site de son activité avec de la rendre plus propre, attractive et confortable pour ses clients. cela lui permettra d'avoir plus de clientèle.
texts.en: Marguerite is a 46 year old woman and mother to one child who is 19 years old and goes to school. She has one dependent in addition to her child. As a business she has a stand where she has been selling food for 2 years in a neighborhood of the town. With this loan she would like to carry out refurbishments at the site of her business to make it cleaner, more attractive and comfortable for her customers. This will allow her to have more customers.

loans.use: to refurbish her restaurant.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Manuel tiene 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a sus hijos y su esposa.  El ha trabajado en agricultura pero hace un año decidió establecer una pulpería para vender granos básicos, carnes, refrescos, churros, manteca, sal, azúcar, granos básicos, pastillas, condimentos y otros productos. Actualmente el administra el negocio y su esposa trabaja en una maquila, para generar otros ingresos y solventar su situación económica. Ha decidido solicitar a ODEF un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar productos y surtir el negocio, comprara carnes, refrescos, granos básicos y otros productos. Con este préstamo mantendrá variedad de productos y espera incrementar sus ventas y los ingresos. Tiene como meta terminar de construir su propia casa y poner allí su pulpería.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Manuel is 36 years old and lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with his wife and three children. He previously worked in agriculture, but a year ago he decided to open a grocery store where he sells basic grains, meats, soft drinks, snack foods, lard, salt, sugar, medicines, condiments, and other products. Juan Manuel currently manages this business while his wife works at a factory as a means of generating additional income to alleviate their financial situation.

He decided to request a loan from ODEF in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that he can by products to restock his business such as meats, soft drinks, basic grains, and other items. With this loan, Juan Manuel will be able to maintain a variety of products, which he hopes will increase his sales and his earnings. His goal is to build a house of his own and set up his store there.

loans.use: to buy meats, soft drinks, basic grains, and other items.

loans.name: Fabricio Edgardo

texts.es:
Fabricio, está trabajando en el cultivo de granos básicos y necesita dinero para invertir en el pago de una máquina desgranadora y el pago de mano de obra para poder sacar la cosecha de la siembra, este préstamo ayudará para mantener el producto listo para la comercialización y la alimentación.

El considera que ha aumentado sus cultivos y la producción de éstos le sirve para poder alimentar a la familia y cubrir algunos gastos, el manifiesta que estos préstamos le han ayudado para realizar su trabajo y mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
Fabricio is cultivating basic grains and needs money so that he can invest in the payment of a threshing machine, as well as pay for labor needed to harvest his crops. This loan will help him maintain an inventory of available products that he can sell and reserve for personal consumption.

Fabricio said that his crop production increased, so he was able to feed his family and cover some of his expenses. He says that the loans have been helpful in allowing him to complete his work and improve his conditions.

loans.use: to make a payment toward a threshing machine and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Las Pecadoras De Bautista Savedra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PECADORAS DE BAUTISTA SAAVEDRA”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, tejedora, tienda de barrio, tejido a máquina, producción y venta de awayos, trenzado de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Victoria es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de tejido en telar, cuenta que estos negocio los emprendió en compañía de su marido quien trabajaba anteriormente en este rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En el fondo vestida con una manta celeste se encuentra la prima de la señora Severina quien quiso retratarse conjuntamente el grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Pecadoras de Bautista Saavedra” is starting its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of seven members and is led by a Board of Direfctors in which Sra. Victoria serves as the treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling regular and dried potatoes, weaving, managing a neighborhood store, producing woven items with the use of a loom, producing and selling “awayos” (traditional Bolivian fabrics), and weaving blankets.

This loan will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs who work in different trades, such as Sra. Victoria. She says that this is the first time she has joined a group with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Victoria currently manages two weaving businesses that she established with her husband, who previously worked in this trade.

The loan she is receiving now will increase her capital for buying wool. She acquires her supplies from distribution companies in the city of El Alto and then produces her goods at her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her household. Victoria is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Victoria said that she enjoys the training seminars that focus on health issues and credit. In the background of the photo, the woman wearing a light-blue shawl is Sra. Severina’s cousin who is posing with the rest of the group.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Kounkorota Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans les ménages polygamiques, les quatre  femmes du groupe  Kounkorota ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants; Elles habitent toutes le village de Jico dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales (mil, niébé et riz), condiments et poissons fumés. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont adhéré au programme de crédits solidaires de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles sont à leur 11ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marama (femme assise à  droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments dans le village de Jico et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500kg de poudre de baobab. Elle se ravitaille en poudres avec les femmes du village et environnants. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes à Ségou. Avec ce prêt, Madame Marama espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mainly in polygamous households, the four women of the group Kounkorota are on average 42 years old and have 5 children. They all live in the village of Jico in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali) and met through neighborhood, family and marriage ties. They are shopkeepers selling cereals (mil [African cereal], black-eyed peas and rice), condiments and smoked fish. With the goal of building up their stock for sale, the members of the group joined the solidarity loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with which they are on their 11th loan cycle in solidarity.

Marama (the woman sitting on the right in the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of condiments in the village of Jico and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to buy 500kg of baobab powder. She resupplies herself in powders with the women from the town and surroundings. The resale is done for cash and credit to a clientèle made up mainly of women in Ségou. With this loan, Marama hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure the care of her children at home.

loans.use: to buy baobab powders.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
Manuel, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, pues necesita invertir en su negocio con la intención de tener un mejor servicio para los clientes, se comprará papel fotográfico, tinta, cuadros, también memoria para cámara, estos materiales le serán muy útiles para poder ofertar a los clientes.

El considera que el préstamo anterior le permitió mejorar su condición en el negocio, dándole una mejor atención a los clientes de los cuales ha recibido un aumento en sus ganancias, sus condiciones económicas considera que a través del negocio están mejorando y por la utilidad de los préstamos, además comenta que su hija se está graduando de bachiller en este mes.
texts.en:
Manuel decided to request a new loan because he needs to invest in his business with the intention of providing better service to his customers. He will buy photo paper, ink, frames, and also memory cards for his camera. These supplies will be very useful in enabling him to provide his services to his customers.

Manuel says that his previous loan allowed him to improve the condition of his business. He was able to provide better service to his customers, which resulted in an increase in his earnings. The financial condition of his business improved with the use of the loans. In addition, he says that his daughter will be graduating from high school this month.

loans.use: to buy photo paper, ink, frames, and memory cards for his camera.

loans.name: Manuel Elenilson

texts.es:
Manuel, está solicitando un préstamo, porque considera necesaria la inversión en la carpintería comprado  los materiales tienen directamente relación para realizar los muebles como madera de diferentes clases, lijas, barniz, entre otras que son necesarias para el trabajo.

Manuel manifiesta que su experiencia con los préstamos ha mejorado la calidad de su negocio, aumentando la producción de muebles para satisfacer los pedidos de los clientes, ha mejorado la calidad y en su familia ha adquirido más ganancias para qué necesidades diarias mejorando su situación económica.
texts.en:
Manuel is requesting a loan because he needs to invest in his carpentry business. He will buy materials for making furniture such as all types of wood, sandpaper, varnish, and other supplies that he needs for his work.

Manuel says that his experience with the loans have improved the quality of his business. He increased his production of furniture so that he could fulfill the orders from his customers. The quality of his products also improved and his family has gained more income to help meet their daily needs and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy wood, sandpaper, varnish, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 48 years old and has four children who are in school.. Sherly is married and is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Sherly requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy rice seed and fertilizers and to pay the farm laborers..

Sherly has been in this business for eight years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Sherly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresa has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Vilma has been in this business for 20 years. Vilma earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a buying and selling seafood business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a loan of 18000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seafood to sell. Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling crabs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to purchase crabs to sell for her business. Gemma has been in this business for 13 years. Gemma earns more income from pig fattening.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase crabs to sell.

loans.name: Layland

texts.en:
Layland is 28 years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Layland runs a business of buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines, and requested a 30000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of accessories to sell. Layland has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Layland would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. 

Leonora is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Marie Jo

texts.en:
Marie Jo is 28 years old and married with one child.

Marie Jo works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store like biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods, and eggs.

Marie Jo has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from farming rice and sugarcane and selling frozen foods.

Marie Jo aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store like biscuits, soft drinks, canned goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Robilinda

texts.en:
Robilinda is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by selling used clothes in the Philippines. Robilinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

Robilinda has been selling used clothes for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

Shirley has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. She earns additional income from her general store and from raising pigs. Shirley is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a photo lamination business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her photo lamination business.

Helen has been in this business for eight years. Helen also earns income by selling ready-to-wear clothing and by farming coconut and selling the dried coconut meat.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.
